ACW

Class Frame

  • java.lang.Object
    • ACW.Frame

  • public class Frame
extends java.lang.Object
    A class gives you a window for easy game development and quick projects.
    Author:
    Asecave

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DISPOSE_ON_CLOSE
      Closes the window where the close button got pressed.
      static int DO_NOTHING_ON_CLOSE
      The close button gets ignored
      static int EXIT_ON_CLOSE
      Stops the program when the close button gets pressed.
      static int HIDE_ON_CLOSE
      The window hides everywhere but the program of the window goes on.

      Frame()
      The normal constructor

    • Method Detail

      • setTargetFPS

        public void setTargetFPS(int FPS)
        Sets the frames target that should get displayed in each second.
        Parameters:
        FPS - - The FPS target

      • getTargetFPS

        public int getTargetFPS()
        Returns the frames target that should get displayed in each second.
        Returns:
        an integer of the target FPS value.

      • setTickSpeed

        public void setTickSpeed(int millis)
        Sets the time interval in milliseconds for one tick.
        Parameters:
        millis - - The time interval in milliseconds for one tick. For more information about ticks click tick().

      • getTickSpeed

        public int getTickSpeed()
        Returns the time interval in milliseconds for one tick.
        Returns:
        an integer value of the interval.

      • getLastFPS

        public float getLastFPS()
        Returns the frames that have been displayed in the last second.
        Returns:
        a float value of the last measured FPS.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        This method has been made to get overwritten. It gets executed on each tick. How long one tick is is defined by the setTargetFPS(int) method.
